oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Elmwood Cemetery Landscape
Confederate Rest, Elmwood Cemetery, Memphis
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Black and white image of a cemetery landscape with magnolia trees surrounding a raised area with a central monument, a short stack of steps, and stones laid out in a line below.

The "Confederate Rest" section of Elmwood Cemetery in Memphis was established during the Civil War. Former Confederate soldiers continued to be buried there over the decades and "Decoration Day" was celebrated by well-known figures including Jefferson Davis and Nathan Bedford Forrest in the 1870s. Today the section is surrounded by large magnolia trees.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Tombs and Sepulchral Monuments, Cemeteries, United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1865
The Persistence of Memory
